intro: Guichenotia seorsiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaf guichenotia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, typically arranged in compact inflorescences. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Guichenotia seorsiflora is adapted to drought conditions and is an important component of native grassland ecosystems.
